title: Amazon Buys Video-Delivery Player Elemental Technologies
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
4 Sep 2015 02:17 AM EST 
Amazon has agreed to acquire Elemental Technologies, a video-encoding and content delivery technology company, to augment its cloud services offerings. Terms of the deal were not disclosed. Amazon is paying about $500 million in cash for Elemental, according to a report by The Information citing an anonymous source. AWS customers include Netflix, which uses the Amazon service for a large portion of its video-streaming delivery. Amazon separately competes with Netflix with Prime Instant Video, an unlimited video-streaming service available to members of its Prime free-shipping program. Elemental has more than 700 customers, powering some of the biggest over-the-top TV apps like HBO Go, BBCâ€™s iPlayer, CNNGo, ESPN ScoreCenter, and Sky Go and Sky Now.
